pullRequest.body:
**RingTheory/HopkinsLevitzki.lean** (new file): the Hopkins--Levitzki theorem says a module over a semiprimary ring is Noetherian iff it's Artinian (iff it's of finite length). As a consequence, a (left) Artinian ring is also (left) Noetherian, and a commutative ring is Artinian iff it's Noetherian and has Krull dimension 0.

**RingTheory/Jacobson/Semiprimary.lean** (new file): contains the definition of semiprimary rings, and connections between Jacobson radicals of modules and semisimplicity.

**RingTheory/Jacobson/Radical.lean** (new file): develop the theory of Jacobson radicals of modules, including versions of Nakayama's lemma over noncommutative rings.

**RingTheory/Artinian/Module.lean**: show an Artinian module or ring is semisimple iff it has trivial radical; show that an Artinian ring is semiprimary.

---

- [x] depends on: #21544

@erdOne The main result of #20096 is proven here.

This seems like a regression. Do you understand how this is connected to the rest of the PR?
At the face of it, this lemma looks like a good simp lemma.
Oh, I made an adjustment in #21544 that made this no longer necessary, but I forgot to revert this change.

Should this be a simp lemma?
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem jacobson_quotient_jacobson : jacobson R (M ‚ß∏ jacobson R M) = ‚ä• := by
```

Idem
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem jacobson_quotient_jacobson : jacobson (R ‚ß∏ jacobson R) = ‚ä• :=
```
This comment gives an equivalent condition for a ring to be artinian, but the theorem below *assumes* that `R` is artinian...

The "if" part holds more generally by [isFiniteLength_iff_isNoetherian_isArtinian](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/FiniteLength.html#isFiniteLength_iff_isNoetherian_isArtinian). How about
```suggestion
@[stacks 00JB "A ring is Artinian if and only if it has finite length as a module over itself.
(For the "if" part, see `isFiniteLength_iff_isNoetherian_isArtinian`.)
Any such ring is both Artinian and Noetherian."]
```

My reading of the lean statement is more something like
```suggestion
/-- For a module over an Artinian ring, the following properties are equivalent:
- being finite (as module)
- being Noetherian
- being Artinian
- being of finite length -/
```

Yeah but I was just quoting a part of the statement of [stacks#00JB](https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/00JB) that is covered by this mathlib theorem. Should I not keep the stacks tag? The other parts are covered by [PrimeSpectrum.MaximalSpectrum.toPiLocalizationEquivtoLocalizationEquiv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Spectrum/Prime/Topology.html#PrimeSpectrum.MaximalSpectrum.toPiLocalizationEquivtoLocalizationEquiv) and the missing instance from IsArtinianRing to DiscreteTopology (PrimeSpectrum _). Maybe I should also correct the double namespace and add the instance in this PR?

Sorry, I am completely confused. That stacks tag is proving a lemma about rings, right? Whereas this mathlib theorem is proving a lemma about modules.
Aren't they just talking about different things?

I think the only nontrivial part in the quoted statement is that an Artinian ring is finite length as a module over itself, and you can derive this from either the Artinian‚ÜîFiniteLength equivalence or the Module.Finite‚ÜîFiniteLength equivalence. But I agree the logic is a bit involved. I propose to move this Stacks tag to the next instance that says IsArtinianRing‚ÜíIsNoetherianRing, and add a comment that reminds the reader that FiniteLength‚ÜîNoetherian+Artinian.
Sounds good to me

In [e2d1b4b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21451/commits/e2d1b4b0aada1da091779ae34bf32d70286b4a17) I added a lemma that corresponds exactly to the first sentence of 00JB. For the NoetherianRing to ArtinianRing instance, I intend to refer to the second sentence, but the reader won't know what "any such ring" refers to unless the first sentence is also included, so what I do is I include both sentences and make the second boldface. Please let me know if you like the commit.

>  the missing instance from IsArtinianRing to DiscreteTopology (PrimeSpectrum _)

Oh it's already there: [PrimeSpectrum.instDiscreteTopology](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Spectrum/Prime/Noetherian.html#PrimeSpectrum.instDiscreteTopology)
Yeah, this looks good to me
